page.title: 01BENENDEN WEALD, INTRODUCTION
page.content: Benenden Weald is a rural area lying between the settlements of Cranbrook, Hawkhurst, Benenden and Iden Green. Settlement is in the form of scattered farm houses, many dating back to well before Tudor times, one of which we studied. Some of its few amenities are connected with education for leisure, such as its two riding schools and Swattenden Field Centre. We chose to spend much of our time studying Forest Farm, particularly the changes which have taken place under the present owner, as this fitted in very well with our sixth-form geography course. The pleasant landscape of the High Weald provided us with several pages. We selected the name because of its connection with school and the generally wooded nature of the land. Local people were unable to provide us with a better one.
